alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Montgomery County through 415 PM CDT... At 342 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Meigs, or 8 miles east of Montgomery, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Montgomery, Mount Meigs, Auburn University In Montgomery, Waugh, Brassell, Mitylene and Cecil. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
